PROJECT PREPARATORY TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE 
 
A.  Objectives 
 
1.  The TA objectives are to (i) design a project suitable for ADB financing, identifying 
appropriate project components to achieve desired results; (ii) review proposed components 
based  on  detailed  due  diligence  assessment  of  technical,  resettlement,  social,  economic, 
financial, environmental, public finance, procurement, and other institutional aspects and risks; 
and (iii) improve capacity on project development and implementation and increase involvement 
of affected persons. The first phase of the TA will include a review of the urban master plan for 
Hetian city and recommendations for improvements, as appropriate, by Tongji University which 
will be selected through a single-source selection method and a lump sum contract with a value 
of $60,000.1The second phase of the TA will be implemented by a single consulting firm with 
two specialized teams of experts - one to prepare a design and another to undertake due 
diligence.  
 
B.  Major Outputs and Activities  
 
2.  Phase  1  of  the  TA  will  consist  of  3  outputs:  (i)  initial  review  report,  (ii)  detailed 
recommendations report, and (iii) capacity developed to incorporate changes. Phase 2 of TA 
will be implemented in two overlapping stages, by a single consulting firm. Under the first stage, 
a project design team will design the project including appropriate schemes for urban upgrading 
with  resettlement.  Under  the  second  stage,  another team  from  the  same  consulting  firm 
will conduct due diligence assessments. The TA’s outputs are summarized in Table A3.1.

D.  Consulting Services 
 
4.  Phase 1 of the TA will have a three person team of national consultants from Tongji 
University, 2 person-months per position,  engaged through SSS method and a lump sum 
contract. Phase 2 of the TA will have a single consulting service package including teams of 
experts for the overlapping stages of project design and due diligence. The design team inputs 
will be 9 person-months for 3 international consultants and 9 person-months for 4 national 
consultants.  The  due  diligence  team  inputs  will  be  10  person-months  for  4  international 
consultants and 11 person-months for 4 national consultants (Table A3.3). The consulting firm 
will  be  engaged  using  fixed  budget  selection  method  with  simplified  technical  proposal 
procedures. Recruitment of consulting services and procurement of equipment under the TA will 
be carried out in accordance with ADB’s Guidelines on the Use of Consultants (2013, as 
amended from time to time) and ADB’s Procurement Guidelines (2015, as amended from time 
to time), respectively. Outline terms of reference are in paras. 5–19.

5.  Urban development expert/ team leader (national, 2 person-months). Experience:             
(i) Preferably at least 20 years in a senior role in advising PRC urban development projects. 
Role: Coordinate the team, responsible for deliverables, and provide high-level advice. 
 
6.  Urban  development  specialists  (national,  2  person-months  each).  Experience:           
(i) Preferably at least 15 years in a senior role in researching PRC urban development projects. 
Role: Provide guidance to HCG including capacity development delivery and reporting. 
 
7.  Urban development specialist/Design team leader (international, 4 person-months). 
Experience: (i) Preferably at least 10 years managing project design financed by international 
finance institutions (IFIs) and preferably at least 15 years of experience in designing urban 
projects. Role: Coordinate team and formulate technical design for inclusive urban regeneration. 
 
8.  Road  specialist/Design  deputy  team  leader  (national,  3.0  person-months). 
Experience:  (i) Preferably at least 7 years in a senior role in managing the design of projects 
financed by IFIs and at least 10 years work experience in detailed engineering and design of 
urban roads, including non-motorized transport. Role: Assist with team leadership and technical 
road design that meets needs and fits urban upgrading and redevelopment models. 
 
9.  Water/wastewater/reclaimed  water  specialist  (international,  2.5  person-months). 
Experience:  Relevant  graduate  degree  in  water  and  wastewater  engineering  and  at  least          
10 years in designing and implementing water, wastewater, and reclaimed water systems in 
urban development projects. Role: Assist with technical water and wastewater design that 
meets government needs and fits with urban upgrading and redevelopment models. 
 
10.  Urban  upgrading/resettlement  specialist  (international,  2.5  person-months). 
Experience: Graduate degree in a relevant field with at least 10 years in resettlement issues in 
IFI-funded investment projects, particularly with ethnic minorities. Role: Formulate a technical 
design that is inclusive and minimizes land acquisition and resettlement. 
 
11.  Social  development  specialist  (national  2  person-months).  Experience:  Preferably 
graduate degree in a relevant field with experience in surveys and analyses with at least 10 
years of work experience in resettlement and indigenous peoples. Role: Provide specialized 
inputs into the deliberations on the strategies and models for urban regeneration. 
 
12.  Public transportation specialist (national, 2 person-months). Experience: Preferably 
have a graduate degree in urban public transport planning, or related degree, preferably at least 
10 years in design of urban public transport systems. Role: Develop a design for the public 
transport component, integrated with and supporting other components and bus service. 
 
13.  Solid  waste  management  specialist  (national,  2  person-months).  Experience: 
Professionally qualified, with a minimum of a graduate degree in civil engineering or a related 
field, and should preferably have at least 8 years work experience in solid waste management. 
Role: Develop an urban sanitation component design that supports the other components. 
 
14.  Social development specialist/Due diligence team leader (international 4 person-
months). Experience: Preferably graduate degree in a relevant field with experience in surveys 
and analyses with at least 15 years of international work experience in resettlement, indigenous 
peoples, and gender and social impact assessments. Role: Lead due diligence team ensuring

4   
 
all requirements are completed on time, including safeguard consultations.  
 
15.  Resettlement  specialist/Due  diligence  deputy  team  leader  (national,  4  person-
months). Experience: Graduate degree in a relevant field with at least 10 years in resettlement 
issues  in  IFI-funded  investment  projects.  Role:  Assist  with  team  leadership.  Formulate  a 
technical design for urban regeneration that is inclusive for all and minimizes LAR.  
 
16.  Environment specialists (international 2.5 person-months; national, 3 person-months). 
Experience: Professionally qualified and preferably have at least 8 years work experience in 
environmental  impact  assessment.  Role:  Undertake  all  assessments  as  required  by  ADB 
Safeguard Policy Statement, in addition to comprehensive water balance analysis. 
 
17.  Gender  equality  specialist  (international,  2  person-months).  Experience:  Relevant 
professional qualifications and preferably 10 years of experience with gender equality and 
gender  responsive  project  design,  particularly  with  ethnic  minorities.  Role:  Review  project 
components and provide inputs to improve the design in terms of gender equality. 
 
18.  Economist (international 1.5 person-months; national, 2 person-months). Experience: 
Relevant qualifications in economics, preferably 10 years work experience, and demonstrated 
practical  experience  in  project  evaluation  vis-à-vis  government  urban  development  plans, 
geographical context, and technical scope adopted by the project. Role: Undertake economic 
due diligence required by ADB guidelines and policies. 
 
19.  Finance specialist (national, 2 person-months). Experience: Relevant qualifications in 
accounting such as a professional accountancy qualification, preferably 10 years work and 
demonstrated  experience  in  estimating financial  internal  rate  of returns.  Role:  All financial 
management assessments required by ADB guidelines and policies. 
 
E.  Implementation Arrangements 
 
20.  Tongji University will work from July to September 2016. The phase 2 consulting firm’s 
design team will be mobilized for 5 months from September 2016 to January 2017. The firm’s 
project due diligence team will assess the project design over 6 months, from November 2016 
to April 2017. The TA will be financially closed in July 2017. XUARG will be the executing 
agency. Workshops and training will be administered by the consulting firms. TA funds will be 
disbursed in accordance with ADB’s Technical Assistance Disbursement Handbook (2010, as 
amended from time to time). The proposed TA implementation schedule is in Table A3.3.
